headline.print_headline: Nominee for Surgeon General Testifies He Would Not Give In to Politics
headline.main: Nominee for Surgeon General Testifies in Senate

docs.lead_paragraph: The nominee, Dr. James W. Holsinger Jr., said he would resign if asked to put politics over science on an important issue.
docs.snippet: The nominee, Dr. James W. Holsinger Jr., said he would resign if asked to put politics over science on an important issue.

docs.abstract: Mike Huckabee's comments about Michael Moore drew a sharp response from one of the filmmaker's associates who accused the Republican presidential candidate of "auditioning for some insurance company dough."
docs.lead_paragraph: Republican presidential candidate Mike Huckabee's comment yesterday that Michael Moore is an example of "why the health care system costs more in this country" -- an apparent reference to Mr. Moore's weight -- drew a sharp response from one of the filmmaker's associates.
docs.snippet: Mike Huckabee's comments about Michael Moore drew a sharp response from one of the filmmaker's associates who accused the Republican presidential candidate of "auditioning for some insurance company dough."

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. James W. Holsinger Jr. told a Senate panel today that he would resign before putting politics over science.
docs.snippet: Dr. James W. Holsinger Jr. told a Senate panel today that he would resign before putting politics over science.

headline.print_headline: Judging a Nominee For Surgeon General
headline.main: Judging a Nominee for Surgeon General (2 Letters)
Judging a Nominee For Surgeon General

docs.abstract: Two letters comment on July 10 editorial expressing reservations about surgeon general nominee Dr James Holsinger because of suggestions that he is prejudiced against homosexuals; Dr Louis W Sullvan says Holsinger is talented physician who is dedicated to caring for health of all Americans; Dr Jerry Douglas takes issue with language of editorial
docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: I do not agree with your editorial regarding Dr. James Holsinger's nomination as surgeon general (''A Nominee's Abnormal Views,'' editorial, July 10). He is a talented physician who has proved throughout his impressive career in public service and education that he is dedicated to caring for all Americans.
docs.snippet: To the Editor:     I do not agree with your editorial regarding Dr. James Holsinger's nomination as surgeon general (''A Nominee's Abnormal Views,'' editorial, July 10). He is a talented physician who has proved throughout his impressive career in...

headline.print_headline: Researchers Find Distinctive Patterns of Cancer in 5 Groups of Asian-Americans
headline.main: Researchers Find Distinctive Patterns of Cancer in 5 Groups of Asian-Americans

docs.lead_paragraph: Asian-Americans have distinctive patterns of cancer incidence that doctors should consider when treating them, researchers found.
docs.snippet: Asian-Americans have distinctive patterns of cancer incidence that doctors should consider when treating them, researchers found.

headline.main: Researchers Find Distinctive Patterns of Cancer in 5 Groups of Asian-Americans

docs.abstract: CA, journal of American Cancer Society, reports Asian-Americans, both those born in US and new immigrants, have distinctive patterns of cancer incidence that doctors should consider when treating them; report is based on California cases from 2000 to 2002 and focuses on five ethnic groups; Asian-Americans have lower rates than other US groups, but different Asian groups appear prone to different types of cancer; graphs (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: Asian-Americans, both those born here and new immigrants, have distinctive patterns of cancer incidence that doctors should consider when treating them, researchers have found. A report appearing today in the journal CA is ''one of the most comprehensive summaries of cancer among Asian-Americans,'' according to the American Cancer Society, which publishes the journal.

headline.print_headline: As Diet Ideas Abound, Is Willpower Obsolete?
headline.main: As Diet Ideas Abound, Is Willpower Obsolete?

docs.lead_paragraph: The importance of willpower in promoting weight loss is becoming an obsolete notion. Is it worth saving?
docs.snippet: The importance of willpower in promoting weight loss is becoming an obsolete notion. Is it worth saving?

headline.print_headline: Difficult Choices for the Old Rec Center
headline.main: Difficult Choices for the Old Rec Center

docs.lead_paragraph: The Parks Department has largely ceded its role as a provider of free youth recreational services, changing the way many of the city’s poorest children play.
docs.snippet: The Parks Department has largely ceded its role as a provider of free youth recreational services, changing the way many of the city’s poorest children play.
